headers.subject: [tosdr:2056] You may cancel your account or paid services at any time

html:
Applies to outlook.com skydrive.com, live.com, account.live.com, profile.microsoft.com, msn.com, bing.com, office.com, Windows Photo Gallery, Windows Movie Maker, Microsoft Mail, Windows Live Writer and "other Microsoft Services" that link to these terms (oddly enough Microsoft.com has a different ToS).



4.3. How can I terminate the services? You may terminate the services at any time and for any reason. You can do this by going to your Account webpage (https://account.live.com) and following the account closure process. To cancel a paid portion of the services, see section 9.10. If you are canceling your services, the quickest means of eliminating your content on the services is to manually remove it from the various components of the services (for example, manually delete your email). However, please note that while content you have deleted or that is associated with a closed account may not be accessible to you, it may still remain on our systems for a period of time.

 

From <http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-live/microsoft-services-agreement> 

--
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr
---

subject: You may cancel your account or paid services at any time
text:
Applies to outlook.com skydrive.com, live.com, account.live.com, 
profile.microsoft.com, msn.com, bing.com, office.com, Windows Photo 
Gallery, Windows Movie Maker, Microsoft Mail, Windows Live Writer and 
"other Microsoft Services" that link to these terms (oddly enough 
Microsoft.com has a different ToS).


4.3. How can I terminate the services? You may terminate the services at 
> any time and for any reason. You can do this by going to your Account<https://account.live.com/> webpage 
> (https://account.live.com) and following the account closure process. To 
> cancel a paid portion of the services, see section 9.10. If you are 
> canceling your services, the quickest means of eliminating your content on 
> the services is to manually remove it from the various components of the 
> services (for example, manually delete your email). However, please note 
> that while content you have deleted or that is associated with a closed 
> account may not be accessible to you, it may still remain on our systems 
> for a period of time.
>
>  
>
> From <
> http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-live/microsoft-services-agreement
> > 
>

--
